reasoning: Parkinson disease incidence ~13.4 per 100k person-years globally (age-adjusted). Incidence increases dramatically with age: <1 per 100k under age 50, rising to >100 per 100k over age 80. Based on systematic review data circa 2005.
source: de Lau LM et al. (2006). Epidemiology of Parkinson's disease. Lancet Neurol. 5(6):525-535
